PSC.name: Corrected Atmospheric Pressure (Adjusted For Site Elevation)
PSC.definition: Atmospheric pressure associated with the MERRA-2 grid has been adjusted based upon the difference between the elevation of an underlying surface site and the average elevation of the MERRA-2 grid cell.

WSC.name: Corrected Wind Speed (Adjusted For Elevation)
WSC.definition: Wind Speed associated with the MERRA-2 grid has been adjusted based upon the elevation and underlying surface roughness.

ALLSKY_KT.name: All Sky Insolation Clearness Index
ALLSKY_KT.definition: A fraction representing clearness of the atmosphere; the all sky insolation that is transmitted through the atmosphere to strike the surface of the earth divided by the average of top of the atmosphere total solar irradiance incident.

ALLSKY_KT_MAX.name: All Sky Insolation Clearness Index Maximum
ALLSKY_KT_MAX.definition: The maximum clearness of the atmosphere; the all sky insolation that is transmitted through the atmosphere to strike the surface of the earth divided by the average of top of the atmosphere total solar irradiance incident.

ALLSKY_KT_MIN.name: All Sky Insolation Clearness Index Minimum
ALLSKY_KT_MIN.definition: The minimum clearness of the atmosphere; the all sky insolation that is transmitted through the atmosphere to strike the surface of the earth divided by the average of top of the atmosphere total solar irradiance incident.

ALLSKY_KT_SD.name: All Sky Insolation Clearness Index Standard Deviation
ALLSKY_KT_SD.definition: The standard deviation of the clearness atmosphere; the all sky insolation that is transmitted through the atmosphere to strike the surface of the earth divided by the average of top of the atmosphere total solar irradiance incident.

ALLSKY_NKT.name: All Sky Normalized Insolation Clearness Index
ALLSKY_NKT.definition: The average zenith angle-independent expression of the all sky insolation clearness index.

ALLSKY_SFC_LW_DWN.name: All Sky Surface Longwave Downward Irradiance
ALLSKY_SFC_LW_DWN.definition: The downward thermal infrared irradiance under all sky conditions reaching a horizontal plane the surface of the earth. Also known as Horizontal Infrared Radiation Intensity from Sky.

ALLSKY_SFC_LW_DWN_MAX.name: All Sky Surface Longwave Downward Irradiance Maximum
ALLSKY_SFC_LW_DWN_MAX.definition: The maximum downward thermal infrared irradiance under all sky conditions reaching a horizontal plane the surface of the earth. Also known as Horizontal Infrared Radiation Intensity from Sky.

ALLSKY_SFC_LW_DWN_MIN.name: All Sky Surface Longwave Downward Irradiance Minimum
ALLSKY_SFC_LW_DWN_MIN.definition: The minimum downward thermal infrared irradiance under all sky conditions reaching a horizontal plane the surface of the earth. Also known as Horizontal Infrared Radiation Intensity from Sky.

ALLSKY_SFC_LW_DWN_SD.name: All Sky Surface Longwave Downward Irradiance Standard Deviation
ALLSKY_SFC_LW_DWN_SD.definition: The standard deviation of downward thermal infrared irradiance under all sky conditions reaching a horizontal plane the surface of the earth. Also known as Horizontal Infrared Radiation Intensity from Sky.

ALLSKY_SFC_LW_UP.name: All Sky Surface Longwave Upward Irradiance
ALLSKY_SFC_LW_UP.definition: The upward thermal infrared irradiance under all sky conditions.

ALLSKY_SFC_LW_UP_MAX.name: All Sky Surface Longwave Upward Irradiance Maximum
ALLSKY_SFC_LW_UP_MAX.definition: The maximum upward thermal infrared irradiance under all sky conditions.

ALLSKY_SFC_LW_UP_MIN.name: All Sky Surface Longwave Upward Irradiance Minimum
ALLSKY_SFC_LW_UP_MIN.definition: The minimum upward thermal infrared irradiance under all sky conditions.

ALLSKY_SFC_LW_UP_SD.name: All Sky Surface Longwave Upward Irradiance Standard Deviation
ALLSKY_SFC_LW_UP_SD.definition: The standard deviation of upward thermal infrared irradiance under all sky conditions.

ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DIFF.name: All Sky Surface Shortwave Diffuse Irradiance
ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DIFF.definition: The diffuse (light energy scattered out of the direction of the sun) solar irradiance incident on a horizontal plane at the surface of the earth under all sky conditions.

ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DIFF_MAX.name: All Sky Surface Shortwave Diffuse Irradiance Maximum
ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DIFF_MAX.definition: The maximum diffuse (light energy scattered out of the direction of the sun) solar irradiance incident on a horizontal plane at the surface of the earth under all sky conditions.

ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DIFF_MIN.name: All Sky Surface Shortwave Diffuse Irradiance Minimum
ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DIFF_MIN.definition: The minimum diffuse (light energy scattered out of the direction of the sun) solar irradiance incident on a horizontal plane at the surface of the earth under all sky conditions.

ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DIFF_SD.name: All Sky Surface Shortwave Diffuse Irradiance Standard Deviation
ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DIFF_SD.definition: The standard deviation of diffuse (light energy scattered out of the direction of the sun) solar irradiance incident on a horizontal plane at the surface of the earth under all sky conditions.

ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DIRH.name: All Sky Surface Shortwave Direct Horizontal Irradiance
ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DIRH.definition: The direct solar irradiance incident on a horizontal plane at the surface of the earth under all sky conditions.

ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DIRH_MAX.name: All Sky Surface Shortwave Direct Horizontal Irradiance Maximum
ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DIRH_MAX.definition: The maximum direct solar irradiance incident on a horizontal plane at the surface of the earth under all sky conditions.

ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DIRH_MIN.name: All Sky Surface Shortwave Direct Horizontal Irradiance Minimum
ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DIRH_MIN.definition: The minimum direct solar irradiance incident on a horizontal plane at the surface of the earth under all sky conditions.

ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DIRH_SD.name: All Sky Surface Shortwave Direct Horizontal Irradiance Standard Deviation
ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DIRH_SD.definition: The standard deviation of direct solar irradiance incident on a horizontal plane at the surface of the earth under all sky conditions.

ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DNI.name: All Sky Surface Shortwave Downward Direct Normal Irradiance
ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DNI.definition: The direct solar irradiance incident to a horizontal plane normal (perpendicular) to the direction of the sun's position under all sky conditions.

ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DNI_MAX.name: All Sky Surface Shortwave Downward Direct Normal Irradiance Maximum
ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DNI_MAX.definition: The maximum direct solar irradiance incident to a horizontal plane normal (perpendicular) to the direction of the sun's position under all sky conditions.

ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DNI_MIN.name: All Sky Surface Shortwave Downward Direct Normal Irradiance Minimum
ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DNI_MIN.definition: The minimum direct solar irradiance incident to a horizontal plane normal (perpendicular) to the direction of the sun's position under all sky conditions.

ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DNI_SD.name: All Sky Surface Shortwave Downward Direct Normal Irradiance Standard Deviation
ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DNI_SD.definition: The standard deviation of direct solar irradiance incident to a horizontal plane normal (perpendicular) to the direction of the sun's position under all sky conditions.

ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DWN.name: All Sky Surface Shortwave Downward Irradiance
ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DWN.definition: The total solar irradiance incident (direct plus diffuse) on a horizontal plane at the surface of the earth under all sky conditions. An alternative term for the total solar irradiance is the "Global Horizontal Irradiance" or GHI.

ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DWN_HR.name: All Sky Surface Shortwave Downward Irradiance at GMT Times
ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DWN_HR.definition: The total solar irradiance incident (direct plus diffuse) on a horizontal plane at the surface of the earth under all sky conditions at GMT Times.

ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DWN_00.name: All Sky Surface Shortwave Downward Irradiance at 00 GMT
ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DWN_00.definition: The total solar irradiance incident (direct plus diffuse) on a horizontal plane at the surface of the earth under all sky conditions at 00 GMT.

ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DWN_01.name: All Sky Surface Shortwave Downward Irradiance at 01 GMT
ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DWN_01.definition: The total solar irradiance incident (direct plus diffuse) on a horizontal plane at the surface of the earth under all sky conditions at 01 GMT.

ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DWN_02.name: All Sky Surface Shortwave Downward Irradiance at 02 GMT
ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DWN_02.definition: The total solar irradiance incident (direct plus diffuse) on a horizontal plane at the surface of the earth under all sky conditions at 02 GMT.

ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DWN_03.name: All Sky Surface Shortwave Downward Irradiance at 03 GMT
ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DWN_03.definition: The total solar irradiance incident (direct plus diffuse) on a horizontal plane at the surface of the earth under all sky conditions at 03 GMT.

ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DWN_04.name: All Sky Surface Shortwave Downward Irradiance at 04 GMT
ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DWN_04.definition: The total solar irradiance incident (direct plus diffuse) on a horizontal plane at the surface of the earth under all sky conditions at 04 GMT.

ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DWN_05.name: All Sky Surface Shortwave Downward Irradiance at 05 GMT
ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DWN_05.definition: The total solar irradiance incident (direct plus diffuse) on a horizontal plane at the surface of the earth under all sky conditions at 05 GMT.

ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DWN_06.name: All Sky Surface Shortwave Downward Irradiance at 06 GMT
ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DWN_06.definition: The total solar irradiance incident (direct plus diffuse) on a horizontal plane at the surface of the earth under all sky conditions at 06 GMT.

ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DWN_07.name: All Sky Surface Shortwave Downward Irradiance at 07 GMT
ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DWN_07.definition: The total solar irradiance incident (direct plus diffuse) on a horizontal plane at the surface of the earth under all sky conditions at 07 GMT.

ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DWN_08.name: All Sky Surface Shortwave Downward Irradiance at 08 GMT
ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DWN_08.definition: The total solar irradiance incident (direct plus diffuse) on a horizontal plane at the surface of the earth under all sky conditions at 08 GMT.

ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DWN_09.name: All Sky Surface Shortwave Downward Irradiance at 09 GMT
ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DWN_09.definition: The total solar irradiance incident (direct plus diffuse) on a horizontal plane at the surface of the earth under all sky conditions at 09 GMT.

ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DWN_10.name: All Sky Surface Shortwave Downward Irradiance at 10 GMT
ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DWN_10.definition: The total solar irradiance incident (direct plus diffuse) on a horizontal plane at the surface of the earth under all sky conditions at 10 GMT.

ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DWN_11.name: All Sky Surface Shortwave Downward Irradiance at 11 GMT
ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DWN_11.definition: The total solar irradiance incident (direct plus diffuse) on a horizontal plane at the surface of the earth under all sky conditions at 11 GMT.

ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DWN_12.name: All Sky Surface Shortwave Downward Irradiance at 12 GMT
ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DWN_12.definition: The total solar irradiance incident (direct plus diffuse) on a horizontal plane at the surface of the earth under all sky conditions at 12 GMT.

ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DWN_13.name: All Sky Surface Shortwave Downward Irradiance at 13 GMT
ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DWN_13.definition: The total solar irradiance incident (direct plus diffuse) on a horizontal plane at the surface of the earth under all sky conditions at 13 GMT.

ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DWN_14.name: All Sky Surface Shortwave Downward Irradiance at 14 GMT
ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DWN_14.definition: The total solar irradiance incident (direct plus diffuse) on a horizontal plane at the surface of the earth under all sky conditions at 14 GMT.

ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DWN_15.name: All Sky Surface Shortwave Downward Irradiance at 15 GMT
ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DWN_15.definition: The total solar irradiance incident (direct plus diffuse) on a horizontal plane at the surface of the earth under all sky conditions at 15 GMT.

ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DWN_16.name: All Sky Surface Shortwave Downward Irradiance at 16 GMT
ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DWN_16.definition: The total solar irradiance incident (direct plus diffuse) on a horizontal plane at the surface of the earth under all sky conditions at 16 GMT.

ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DWN_17.name: All Sky Surface Shortwave Downward Irradiance at 17 GMT
ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DWN_17.definition: The total solar irradiance incident (direct plus diffuse) on a horizontal plane at the surface of the earth under all sky conditions at 17 GMT.

ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DWN_18.name: All Sky Surface Shortwave Downward Irradiance at 18 GMT
ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DWN_18.definition: The total solar irradiance incident (direct plus diffuse) on a horizontal plane at the surface of the earth under all sky conditions at 18 GMT.

ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DWN_19.name: All Sky Surface Shortwave Downward Irradiance at 19 GMT
ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DWN_19.definition: The total solar irradiance incident (direct plus diffuse) on a horizontal plane at the surface of the earth under all sky conditions at 19 GMT.

ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DWN_20.name: All Sky Surface Shortwave Downward Irradiance at 20 GMT
ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DWN_20.definition: The total solar irradiance incident (direct plus diffuse) on a horizontal plane at the surface of the earth under all sky conditions at 20 GMT.

ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DWN_21.name: All Sky Surface Shortwave Downward Irradiance at 21 GMT
ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DWN_21.definition: The total solar irradiance incident (direct plus diffuse) on a horizontal plane at the surface of the earth under all sky conditions at 21 GMT.

ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DWN_22.name: All Sky Surface Shortwave Downward Irradiance at 22 GMT
ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DWN_22.definition: The total solar irradiance incident (direct plus diffuse) on a horizontal plane at the surface of the earth under all sky conditions at 22 GMT.

ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DWN_23.name: All Sky Surface Shortwave Downward Irradiance at 23 GMT
ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DWN_23.definition: The total solar irradiance incident (direct plus diffuse) on a horizontal plane at the surface of the earth under all sky conditions at 23 GMT.

ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DWN_MAX.name: All Sky Surface Shortwave Downward Irradiance Maximum
ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DWN_MAX.definition: The maximum total solar irradiance incident (direct plus diffuse) on a horizontal plane at the surface of the earth under all sky conditions.

ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DWN_MIN.name: All Sky Surface Shortwave Downward Irradiance Minimum
ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DWN_MIN.definition: The minimum total solar irradiance incident (direct plus diffuse) on a horizontal plane at the surface of the earth under all sky conditions.

ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DWN_SD.name: All Sky Surface Shortwave Downward Irradiance Standard Deviation
ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DWN_SD.definition: The standard deviation total solar irradiance incident (direct plus diffuse) on a horizontal plane at the surface of the earth under all sky conditions.

ALLSKY_SFC_SW_UP.name: All Sky Surface Shortwave Upward Irradiance
ALLSKY_SFC_SW_UP.definition: The upward shortwave irradiance under all sky conditions.

ALLSKY_SFC_SW_UP_MAX.name: All Sky Surface Shortwave Upward Irradiance Maximum
ALLSKY_SFC_SW_UP_MAX.definition: The maximum upward shortwave irradiance under all sky conditions.

ALLSKY_SFC_SW_UP_MIN.name: All Sky Surface Shortwave Upward Irradiance Minimum
ALLSKY_SFC_SW_UP_MIN.definition: The minimum upward shortwave irradiance under all sky conditions.

ALLSKY_SFC_SW_UP_SD.name: All Sky Surface Shortwave Upward Irradiance Standard Deviation
ALLSKY_SFC_SW_UP_SD.definition: The standard deviation of upward shortwave irradiance under all sky conditions.

ALLSKY_SRF_ALB.name: All Sky Surface Albedo
ALLSKY_SRF_ALB.definition: The all sky rate of reflectivity of the earth's surface; the ratio of the solar energy reflected by the surface of the earth compared to the total solar energy incident reaching the surface of the earth.

AOD_55.name: Aerosol Optical Depth 55
AOD_55.definition: The optical thickness at 0.55 um measured vertically; the component of the atmosphere to quantify the removal of radiant energy from an incident beam.

AOD_84.name: Aerosol Optical Depth 84
AOD_84.definition: The optical thickness at 0.84 um measured vertically; the component of the atmosphere to quantify the removal of radiant energy from an incident beam.

CDD0.name: Cooling Degree Days Above 0 C
CDD0.definition: The daily accumulation of degrees when the daily mean temperature is above 0 degrees Celsius.

CDD10.name: Cooling Degree Days Above 10 C
CDD10.definition: The daily accumulation of degrees when the daily mean temperature is above 10 degrees Celsius.

CDD18_3.name: Cooling Degree Days Above 18.3 C
CDD18_3.definition: The daily accumulation of degrees when the daily mean temperature is above 18.3 degrees Celsius.

CLOUD_AMT.name: Cloud Amount
CLOUD_AMT.definition: The average percent of cloud amount during the temporal period.

CLOUD_AMT_HR.name: Cloud Amount at GMT Times
CLOUD_AMT_HR.definition: The average percent of cloud amount during daylight at GMT Times.

CLOUD_AMT_00.name: Cloud Amount at 00 GMT
CLOUD_AMT_00.definition: The average percent of cloud amount during daylight at 00 GMT.

CLOUD_AMT_01.name: Cloud Amount at 01 GMT
CLOUD_AMT_01.definition: The average percent of cloud amount during daylight at 01 GMT.

CLOUD_AMT_02.name: Cloud Amount at 02 GMT
CLOUD_AMT_02.definition: The average percent of cloud amount during daylight at 02 GMT.

CLOUD_AMT_03.name: Cloud Amount at 03 GMT
CLOUD_AMT_03.definition: The average percent of cloud amount during daylight at 03 GMT.

CLOUD_AMT_04.name: Cloud Amount at 04 GMT
CLOUD_AMT_04.definition: The average percent of cloud amount during daylight at 04 GMT.

CLOUD_AMT_05.name: Cloud Amount at 05 GMT
CLOUD_AMT_05.definition: The average percent of cloud amount during daylight at 05 GMT.

CLOUD_AMT_06.name: Cloud Amount at 06 GMT
CLOUD_AMT_06.definition: The average percent of cloud amount during daylight at 06 GMT.

CLOUD_AMT_07.name: Cloud Amount at 07 GMT
CLOUD_AMT_07.definition: The average percent of cloud amount during daylight at 07 GMT.

CLOUD_AMT_08.name: Cloud Amount at 08 GMT
CLOUD_AMT_08.definition: The average percent of cloud amount during daylight at 08 GMT.

CLOUD_AMT_09.name: Cloud Amount at 09 GMT
CLOUD_AMT_09.definition: The average percent of cloud amount during daylight at 09 GMT.

CLOUD_AMT_10.name: Cloud Amount at 10 GMT
CLOUD_AMT_10.definition: The average percent of cloud amount during daylight at 10 GMT.

CLOUD_AMT_11.name: Cloud Amount at 11 GMT
CLOUD_AMT_11.definition: The average percent of cloud amount during daylight at 11 GMT.

CLOUD_AMT_12.name: Cloud Amount at 12 GMT
CLOUD_AMT_12.definition: The average percent of cloud amount during daylight at 12 GMT.

CLOUD_AMT_13.name: Cloud Amount at 13 GMT
CLOUD_AMT_13.definition: The average percent of cloud amount during daylight at 13 GMT.

CLOUD_AMT_14.name: Cloud Amount at 14 GMT
CLOUD_AMT_14.definition: The average percent of cloud amount during daylight at 14 GMT.

CLOUD_AMT_15.name: Cloud Amount at 15 GMT
CLOUD_AMT_15.definition: The average percent of cloud amount during daylight at 15 GMT.

CLOUD_AMT_16.name: Cloud Amount at 16 GMT
CLOUD_AMT_16.definition: The average percent of cloud amount during daylight at 16 GMT.

CLOUD_AMT_17.name: Cloud Amount at 17 GMT
CLOUD_AMT_17.definition: The average percent of cloud amount during daylight at 17 GMT.

CLOUD_AMT_18.name: Cloud Amount at 18 GMT
CLOUD_AMT_18.definition: The average percent of cloud amount during daylight at 18 GMT.

CLOUD_AMT_19.name: Cloud Amount at 19 GMT
CLOUD_AMT_19.definition: The average percent of cloud amount during daylight at 19 GMT.

CLOUD_AMT_20.name: Cloud Amount at 20 GMT
CLOUD_AMT_20.definition: The average percent of cloud amount during daylight at 20 GMT.

CLOUD_AMT_21.name: Cloud Amount at 21 GMT
CLOUD_AMT_21.definition: The average percent of cloud amount during daylight at 21 GMT.

CLOUD_AMT_22.name: Cloud Amount at 22 GMT
CLOUD_AMT_22.definition: The average percent of cloud amount during daylight at 22 GMT.

CLOUD_AMT_23.name: Cloud Amount at 23 GMT
CLOUD_AMT_23.definition: The average percent of cloud amount during daylight at 23 GMT.

CLOUD_AMT_DAY.name: Cloud Amount at Daytime
CLOUD_AMT_DAY.definition: The average percent of cloud amount during daylight.

CLOUD_AMT_NIGHT.name: Cloud Amount at Nighttime
CLOUD_AMT_NIGHT.definition: The average percent of cloud amount during nighttime.

CLOUD_OD.name: Cloud Optical Visible Depth
CLOUD_OD.definition: The vertical optical thickness between the top and bottom of a cloud.

CLOUD_OD_HR.name: Cloud Optical Visible Depth at GMT Times
CLOUD_OD_HR.definition: The vertical optical thickness between the top and bottom of a cloud at GMT Times.

CLOUD_OD_00.name: Cloud Optical Visible Depth at 00 GMT
CLOUD_OD_00.definition: The vertical optical thickness between the top and bottom of a cloud at 00 GMT.

CLOUD_OD_01.name: Cloud Optical Visible Depth at 01 GMT
CLOUD_OD_01.definition: The vertical optical thickness between the top and bottom of a cloud at 01 GMT.

CLOUD_OD_02.name: Cloud Optical Visible Depth at 02 GMT
CLOUD_OD_02.definition: The vertical optical thickness between the top and bottom of a cloud at 02 GMT.

CLOUD_OD_03.name: Cloud Optical Visible Depth at 03 GMT
CLOUD_OD_03.definition: The vertical optical thickness between the top and bottom of a cloud at 03 GMT.

CLOUD_OD_04.name: Cloud Optical Visible Depth at 04 GMT
CLOUD_OD_04.definition: The vertical optical thickness between the top and bottom of a cloud at 04 GMT.

CLOUD_OD_05.name: Cloud Optical Visible Depth at 05 GMT
CLOUD_OD_05.definition: The vertical optical thickness between the top and bottom of a cloud at 05 GMT.

CLOUD_OD_06.name: Cloud Optical Visible Depth at 06 GMT
CLOUD_OD_06.definition: The vertical optical thickness between the top and bottom of a cloud at 06 GMT.

CLOUD_OD_07.name: Cloud Optical Visible Depth at 07 GMT
CLOUD_OD_07.definition: The vertical optical thickness between the top and bottom of a cloud at 07 GMT.

CLOUD_OD_08.name: Cloud Optical Visible Depth at 08 GMT
CLOUD_OD_08.definition: The vertical optical thickness between the top and bottom of a cloud at 08 GMT.

CLOUD_OD_09.name: Cloud Optical Visible Depth at 09 GMT
CLOUD_OD_09.definition: The vertical optical thickness between the top and bottom of a cloud at 09 GMT.

CLOUD_OD_10.name: Cloud Optical Visible Depth at 10 GMT
CLOUD_OD_10.definition: The vertical optical thickness between the top and bottom of a cloud at 10 GMT.

CLOUD_OD_11.name: Cloud Optical Visible Depth at 11 GMT
CLOUD_OD_11.definition: The vertical optical thickness between the top and bottom of a cloud at 11 GMT.

CLOUD_OD_12.name: Cloud Optical Visible Depth at 12 GMT
CLOUD_OD_12.definition: The vertical optical thickness between the top and bottom of a cloud at 12 GMT.

CLOUD_OD_13.name: Cloud Optical Visible Depth at 13 GMT
CLOUD_OD_13.definition: The vertical optical thickness between the top and bottom of a cloud at 13 GMT.

CLOUD_OD_14.name: Cloud Optical Visible Depth at 14 GMT
CLOUD_OD_14.definition: The vertical optical thickness between the top and bottom of a cloud at 14 GMT.

CLOUD_OD_15.name: Cloud Optical Visible Depth at 15 GMT
CLOUD_OD_15.definition: The vertical optical thickness between the top and bottom of a cloud at 15 GMT.

CLOUD_OD_16.definition: The vertical optical thickness between the top and bottom of a cloud at 16 GMT.

CLOUD_OD_17.name: Cloud Optical Visible Depth at 17 GMT
CLOUD_OD_17.definition: The vertical optical thickness between the top and bottom of a cloud at 17 GMT.

CLOUD_OD_18.name: Cloud Optical Visible Depth at 18 GMT
CLOUD_OD_18.definition: The vertical optical thickness between the top and bottom of a cloud at 18 GMT.

CLOUD_OD_19.name: Cloud Optical Visible Depth at 19 GMT
CLOUD_OD_19.definition: The vertical optical thickness between the top and bottom of a cloud at 19 GMT.

CLOUD_OD_20.name: Cloud Optical Visible Depth at 20 GMT
CLOUD_OD_20.definition: The vertical optical thickness between the top and bottom of a cloud at 20 GMT.

CLOUD_OD_21.name: Cloud Optical Visible Depth at 21 GMT
CLOUD_OD_21.definition: The vertical optical thickness between the top and bottom of a cloud at 21 GMT.

CLOUD_OD_22.name: Cloud Optical Visible Depth at 22 GMT
CLOUD_OD_22.definition: The vertical optical thickness between the top and bottom of a cloud at 22 GMT.

CLOUD_OD_23.name: Cloud Optical Visible Depth at 23 GMT
CLOUD_OD_23.definition: The vertical optical thickness between the top and bottom of a cloud at 23 GMT.

CLRSKY_DAYS.name: Clear Sky Day
CLRSKY_DAYS.definition: The number of Clear Sky Days if the daytime cloud amount is less than 10 percent.

CLRSKY_KT.name: Clear Sky Insolation Clearness Index
CLRSKY_KT.definition: A fraction representing clearness of the atmosphere; the clear sky insolation that is transmitted through the atmosphere to strike the surface of the earth divided by the average of top of the atmosphere total solar irradiance incident.

CLRSKY_KT_MAX.name: Clear Sky Insolation Clearness Index Maximum
CLRSKY_KT_MAX.definition: The maximum clearness of the atmosphere; the clear sky insolation that is transmitted through the atmosphere to strike the surface of the earth divided by the average of top of the atmosphere total solar irradiance incident.

CLRSKY_KT_MIN.name: Clear Sky Insolation Clearness Index Minimum
CLRSKY_KT_MIN.definition: The minimum clearness of the atmosphere; the clear sky insolation that is transmitted through the atmosphere to strike the surface of the earth divided by the average of top of the atmosphere total solar irradiance incident.

CLRSKY_KT_SD.name: Clear Sky Insolation Clearness Index Standard Deviation
CLRSKY_KT_SD.definition: The standard deviation of the clearness atmosphere; the clear sky insolation that is transmitted through the atmosphere to strike the surface of the earth divided by the average of top of the atmosphere total solar irradiance incident.

CLRSKY_NKT.name: Clear Sky Normalized Insolation Clearness Index
CLRSKY_NKT.definition: The average zenith angle-independent expression of the clear sky insolation clearness index.

CLRSKY_SFC_LW_DWN.name: Clear Sky Surface Longwave Downward Irradiance
CLRSKY_SFC_LW_DWN.definition: The downward thermal infrared irradiance under clear sky conditions reaching a horizontal plane the surface of the earth. Also known as Horizontal Infrared Radiation Intensity from Sky.

CLRSKY_SFC_LW_DWN_MAX.name: Clear Sky Surface Longwave Downward Irradiance Maximum
CLRSKY_SFC_LW_DWN_MAX.definition: The maximum downward thermal infrared irradiance under clear sky conditions reaching a horizontal plane the surface of the earth. Also known as Horizontal Infrared Radiation Intensity from Sky.

CLRSKY_SFC_LW_DWN_MIN.name: Clear Sky Surface Longwave Downward Irradiance Minimum
CLRSKY_SFC_LW_DWN_MIN.definition: The minimum downward thermal infrared irradiance under clear sky conditions reaching a horizontal plane the surface of the earth. Also known as Horizontal Infrared Radiation Intensity from Sky.

CLRSKY_SFC_LW_DWN_SD.name: Clear Sky Surface Longwave Downward Irradiance Standard Deviation
CLRSKY_SFC_LW_DWN_SD.definition: The standard deviation of downward thermal infrared irradiance under clear sky conditions reaching a horizontal plane the surface of the earth. Also known as Horizontal Infrared Radiation Intensity from Sky.

CLRSKY_SFC_LW_UP.name: Clear Sky Surface Longwave Upward Irradiance
CLRSKY_SFC_LW_UP.definition: The upward thermal infrared irradiance under clear sky conditions.

CLRSKY_SFC_LW_UP_MAX.name: Clear Sky Surface Longwave Upward Irradiance Maximum
CLRSKY_SFC_LW_UP_MAX.definition: The maximum upward thermal infrared irradiance under clear sky conditions.

CLRSKY_SFC_LW_UP_MIN.name: Clear Sky Surface Longwave Upward Irradiance Minimum
CLRSKY_SFC_LW_UP_MIN.definition: The minimum upward thermal infrared irradiance under clear sky conditions.

CLRSKY_SFC_LW_UP_SD.name: Clear Sky Surface Longwave Upward Irradiance Standard Deviation
CLRSKY_SFC_LW_UP_SD.definition: The standard deviation of upward thermal infrared irradiance under clear sky conditions

CLRSKY_SFC_SW_DWN.name: Clear Sky Surface Shortwave Downward Irradiance
CLRSKY_SFC_SW_DWN.definition: The total solar irradiance incident (direct plus diffuse) on a horizontal plane at the surface of the earth under clear sky conditions. An alternative term for the total solar irradiance is the "Global Horizontal Irradiance" or GHI.

CLRSKY_SFC_SW_DWN_MAX.name: Clear Sky Surface Shortwave Downward Irradiance Maximum
CLRSKY_SFC_SW_DWN_MAX.definition: The maximum total solar irradiance incident (direct plus diffuse) on a horizontal plane at the surface of the earth under clear sky conditions.

CLRSKY_SFC_SW_DWN_MIN.name: Clear Sky Surface Shortwave Downward Irradiance Minimum
CLRSKY_SFC_SW_DWN_MIN.definition: The minimum total solar irradiance incident (direct plus diffuse) on a horizontal plane at the surface of the earth under clear sky conditions.

CLRSKY_SFC_SW_DWN_SD.name: Clear Sky Surface Shortwave Downward Irradiance Standard Deviation
CLRSKY_SFC_SW_DWN_SD.definition: The standard deviation of total solar irradiance incident (direct plus diffuse) on a horizontal plane at the surface of the earth under clear sky conditions.

CLRSKY_SFC_SW_UP.name: Clear Sky Surface Shortwave Upward Irradiance
CLRSKY_SFC_SW_UP.definition: The upward shortwave irradiance under clearsky conditions.

CLRSKY_SFC_SW_UP_MAX.name: Clear Sky Surface Shortwave Upward Irradiance Maximum
CLRSKY_SFC_SW_UP_MAX.definition: The maximum upward shortwave irradiance under clearsky conditions.

CLRSKY_SFC_SW_UP_MIN.name: Clear Sky Surface Shortwave Upward Irradiance Minimum
CLRSKY_SFC_SW_UP_MIN.definition: The minimum upward shortwave irradiance under clearsky conditions.

CLRSKY_SFC_SW_UP_SD.name: Clear Sky Surface Shortwave Upward Irradiance Standard Deviation
CLRSKY_SFC_SW_UP_SD.definition: The standard deviation of upward shortwave irradiance under clearsky conditions.

CLRSKY_SRF_ALB.name: Clear Sky Surface Albedo
CLRSKY_SRF_ALB.definition: The clear sky rate of reflectivity of the earth's surface; the ratio of the solar energy reflected by the surface of the earth compared to the total solar energy incident reaching the surface of the earth.

DIFFUSE_ILLUMINANCE.name: Diffuse Illuminance
DIFFUSE_ILLUMINANCE.definition: The average amount of illuminance received directly from the solar disk on a surface perpendicular to the suns rays.

DIRECT_ILLUMINANCE.name: Direct Illuminance
DIRECT_ILLUMINANCE.definition: The average amount of illuminance received from the sky (excluding the solar disk) on a horizontal plane.

DISPH.name: Zero Plane Displacement Height
DISPH.definition: The height at which the mean velocity is zero due to large obstacles such as buildings/canopy.

EVLAND.name: Evaporation Land
EVLAND.definition: The evaporation over land at the surface of the earth.

EVPTRNS.name: Evapotranspiration Energy Flux
EVPTRNS.definition: The evapotranspiration energy flux at the surface of the earth.

FROST_DAYS.name: Frost Days
FROST_DAYS.definition: A frost day occurs when the 2m temperature cools to the dew point temperature and both are less than 0 C or 32 F.

FRSEAICE.name: Ice Covered Fraction
FRSEAICE.definition: The fraction of ocean covered by sea ice.

FRSNO.name: Land Snowcover Fraction
FRSNO.definition: The fraction of land covered by snowfall.

GLOBAL_ILLUMINANCE.name: Global Illuminance
GLOBAL_ILLUMINANCE.definition: The average total amount of direct and diffuse illuminance on a horizontal plane.

HDD0.name: Heating Degree Days Below 0 C
HDD0.definition: The daily accumulation of degrees when the daily mean temperature is below 0 degrees Celsius.

HDD10.name: Heating Degree Days Below 10 C
HDD10.definition: The daily accumulation of degrees when the daily mean temperature is below 10 degrees Celsius.

HDD18_3.name: Heating Degree Days Below 18.3 C
HDD18_3.definition: The daily accumulation of degrees when the daily mean temperature is below 15.3 degrees Celsius.

MIDDAY_INSOL.name: Midday Insolation Incident
MIDDAY_INSOL.definition: The total amount of solar irradiance (i.e. direct plus diffuse) incident on a horizontal plane at the earth's surface during the solar noon hour midday period.

MIDDAY_INSOL_MAX.name: Midday Insolation Incident Maximum
MIDDAY_INSOL_MAX.definition: The maximum total amount of solar irradiance (i.e. direct plus diffuse) incident on a horizontal plane at the earth's surface during the solar noon hour midday period.

MIDDAY_INSOL_MIN.name: Midday Insolation Incident Minimum
MIDDAY_INSOL_MIN.definition: The minimum total amount of solar irradiance (i.e. direct plus diffuse) incident on a horizontal plane at the earth's surface during the solar noon hour midday period.

MIDDAY_INSOL_SD.name: Midday Insolation Incident Standard Deviation
MIDDAY_INSOL_SD.definition: The standard deviation of the total amount of solar irradiance (i.e. direct plus diffuse) incident on a horizontal plane at the earth's surface during the solar noon hour midday period.

PBLTOP.name: Planetary Boundary Layer Top Pressure
PBLTOP.definition: The pressure at the top of the planet boundary layer.

PRECSNOLAND.name: Snow Precipitation Land
PRECSNOLAND.definition: The snow precipitation only over land at the surface of the earth.

PRECSNOLAND_SUM.name: Snow Precipitation Land Sum
PRECSNOLAND_SUM.definition: The snow precipitation sum over land at the surface of the earth.

PRECTOTCORR.name: Precipitation Corrected
PRECTOTCORR.definition: The bias corrected average of total precipitation at the surface of the earth in water mass (includes water content in snow).

PRECTOTCORR_SUM.name: Precipitation Corrected Sum
PRECTOTCORR_SUM.definition: The bias corrected sum of total precipitation at the surface of the earth.

PS.name: Surface Pressure
PS.definition: The average of surface pressure at the surface of the earth.

PW.name: Precipitable Water
PW.definition: The total atmospheric water vapor contained in a vertical column of the atmosphere.

QV10M.name: Specific Humidity at 10 Meters
QV10M.definition: The ratio of the mass of water vapor to the total mass of air at 10 meters (kg water/kg total air).

QV2M.name: Specific Humidity at 2 Meters
QV2M.definition: The ratio of the mass of water vapor to the total mass of air at 2 meters (kg water/kg total air).

RH2M.name: Relative Humidity at 2 Meters
RH2M.definition: The ratio of actual partial pressure of water vapor to the partial pressure at saturation, expressed in percent.

RHOA.name: Surface Air Density
RHOA.definition: The air density at surface of the earth.

SG_DAY_HOURS.name: Solar Geometry Day Hours
SG_DAY_HOURS.definition: The number of hours where solar irradiance is present; determined if the solar zenith angle is between 0 and 90 degrees.

SLP.name: Sea Level Pressure
SLP.definition: The sea level pressure at the surface of the earth.

SNODP.name: Snow Depth
SNODP.definition: The snow depth on land at surface of the earth.

SZA.name: Solar Zenith Angle
SZA.definition: The angle between the geodetic zenith vector and a vector from the earth point to the sun integrated over the period.

T10M.name: Temperature at 10 Meters
T10M.definition: The air (dry bulb) temperature at 10 meters above the surface of the earth.

T10M_MAX.name: Temperature at 10 Meters Maximum
T10M_MAX.definition: The maximum hourly air (dry bulb) temperature at 10 meters above the surface of the earth in the period of interest.

T10M_MAX_AVG.name: Temperature at 10 Meters Maximum Average
T10M_MAX_AVG.definition: The average of the daily maximum air (dry bulb) temperature at 10 meters above the surface of the earth in the period of interest.

T10M_MIN.name: Temperature at 10 Meters Minimum
T10M_MIN.definition: The minimum hourly air (dry bulb) temperature at 10 meters above the surface of the earth in the period of interest.

T10M_MIN_AVG.name: Temperature at 10 Meters Minimum Average
T10M_MIN_AVG.definition: The average of the daily minimum air (dry bulb) temperature at 10 meters above the surface of the earth in the period of interest.

T10M_RANGE.name: Temperature at 10 Meters Range
T10M_RANGE.definition: The minimum and maximum hourly air (dry bulb) temperature range at 10 meters above the surface of the earth in the period of interest.

T10M_RANGE_AVG.name: Temperature at 10 Meters Range Average
T10M_RANGE_AVG.definition: The average minimum and maximum daily air (dry bulb) temperature average range at 10 meters above the surface of the earth in the period of interest.

T2M.name: Temperature at 2 Meters
T2M.definition: The average air (dry bulb) temperature at 2 meters above the surface of the earth.

T2M_MAX.name: Temperature at 2 Meters Maximum
T2M_MAX.definition: The maximum hourly air (dry bulb) temperature at 2 meters above the surface of the earth in the period of interest.

T2M_MAX_AVG.name: Temperature at 2 Meters Maximum Average
T2M_MAX_AVG.definition: The average of the daily maximum air (dry bulb) temperature at 2 meters above the surface of the earth in the period of interest.

T2M_MIN.name: Temperature at 2 Meters Minimum
T2M_MIN.definition: The minimum hourly air (dry bulb) temperature at 2 meters above the surface of the earth in the period of interest.

T2M_MIN_AVG.name: Temperature at 2 Meters Minimum Average
T2M_MIN_AVG.definition: The average of the daily minimum air (dry bulb) temperature at 2 meters above the surface of the earth in the period of interest.

T2M_RANGE.name: Temperature at 2 Meters Range
T2M_RANGE.definition: The minimum and maximum hourly air (dry bulb) temperature range at 2 meters above the surface of the earth in the period of interest.

T2M_RANGE_AVG.name: Temperature at 2 Meters Range Average
T2M_RANGE_AVG.definition: The average minimum and maximum daily air (dry bulb) temperature average range at 2 meters above the surface of the earth in the period of interest.

T2MDEW.name: Dew/Frost Point at 2 Meters
T2MDEW.definition: The dew/frost point temperature at 2 meters above the surface of the earth.

T2MWET.name: Wet Bulb Temperature at 2 Meters
T2MWET.definition: The adiabatic saturation temperature which can be measured by a thermometer covered in a water-soaked cloth over which air is passed at 2 meters above the surface of the earth.

TO3.name: Total Column Ozone
TO3.definition: The total amount of ozone in a column extending vertically from the earth's surface to the top of the atmosphere.

TOA_SW_DNI.name: Top-Of-Atmosphere Shortwave Direct Normal Radiation
TOA_SW_DNI.definition: The total solar irradiance incident (direct plus diffuse) on a horizontal plane where oriented to the sun's position at the top of the atmosphere (extraterrestrial radiation).

TOA_SW_DNI_MAX.name: Top-Of-Atmosphere Shortwave Direct Normal Radiation Maximum
TOA_SW_DNI_MAX.definition: The maximum total solar irradiance incident (direct plus diffuse) on a horizontal plane where oriented to the sun's position at the top of the atmosphere (extraterrestrial radiation).

TOA_SW_DNI_MIN.name: Top-Of-Atmosphere Shortwave Direct Normal Radiation Minimum
TOA_SW_DNI_MIN.definition: The minimum total solar irradiance incident (direct plus diffuse) on a horizontal plane where oriented to the sun's position at the top of the atmosphere (extraterrestrial radiation).

TOA_SW_DNI_SD.name: Top-Of-Atmosphere Shortwave Direct Normal Radiation Standard Deviation
TOA_SW_DNI_SD.definition: The standard deviation of total solar irradiance incident (direct plus diffuse) on a horizontal plane where oriented to the sun's position at the top of the atmosphere (extraterrestrial radiation).

TOA_SW_DWN.name: Top-Of-Atmosphere Shortwave Downward Irradiance
TOA_SW_DWN.definition: The total solar irradiance incident (direct plus diffuse) on a horizontal plane at the top of the atmosphere (extraterrestrial radiation).

TOA_SW_DWN_MAX.name: Top-Of-Atmosphere Shortwave Downward Irradiance Maximum
TOA_SW_DWN_MAX.definition: The maximum total solar irradiance incident (direct plus diffuse) on a horizontal plane at the top of the atmosphere (extraterrestrial radiation).

TOA_SW_DWN_MIN.name: Top-Of-Atmosphere Shortwave Downward Irradiance Minimum
TOA_SW_DWN_MIN.definition: The minimum total solar irradiance incident (direct plus diffuse) on a horizontal plane at the top of the atmosphere (extraterrestrial radiation).

TOA_SW_DWN_SD.name: Top-Of-Atmosphere Shortwave Downward Irradiance Standard Deviation
TOA_SW_DWN_SD.definition: The standard deviation of total solar irradiance incident (direct plus diffuse) on a horizontal plane at the top of the atmosphere (extraterrestrial radiation).

TQV.name: Total Column Precipitable Water
TQV.definition: The total atmospheric water vapor contained in a vertical column of unit cross-sectional area extending from the surface to the top of the atmosphere.

TROPPB.name: Tropopause Pressure based on blended estimate.
TROPPB.definition: The tropopause pressure based on the blended estimate.

TROPQ.name: Tropopause Specific Humidity using blended TROPP estimate.
TROPQ.definition: The ratio of the mass of water vapor to the total mass of air at the tropopause pressure given by TROPPB (kg water/kg total air).

TROPT.name: Tropopause Temperature using blended TROPP estimate.
TROPT.definition: The air (dry bulb) temperature at the tropopause pressure given by TROPPB.

TS.name: Earth Skin Temperature
TS.definition: The average temperature at the earth's surface.

TS_MAX.name: Earth Skin Temperature Maximum
TS_MAX.definition: The maximum hourly earth skin temperature in the period of interest.

TS_MAX_AVG.name: Earth Skin Temperature Maximum Average
TS_MAX_AVG.definition: The average of the daily maximum earth skin temperature in the period of interest.

TS_MIN.name: Earth Skin Temperature Minimum
TS_MIN.definition: The minimum hourly earth skin temperature in the period of interest.

TS_MIN_AVG.name: Earth Skin Temperature Minimum Average
TS_MIN_AVG.definition: The average of the daily minimum earth skin temperature in the period of interest.

TS_RANGE.name: Earth Skin Temperature Range
TS_RANGE.definition: The minimum and maximum hourly earth skin temperature range in the period of interest.

TS_RANGE_AVG.name: Earth Skin Temperature Range Average
TS_RANGE_AVG.definition: The average minimum and maximum daily earth skin temperature range in the period of interest.

U10M.name: Eastward Wind at 10 Meters
U10M.definition: The estimate of the eastward wind average speed for winds blowing 10 meters above the surface of the earth.

U2M.name: Eastward Wind at 2 Meters
U2M.definition: The estimate of the eastward wind average speed for winds blowing 2 meters above the surface of the earth.

U50M.name: Eastward Wind at 50 Meters
U50M.definition: The estimate of the eastward wind average speed for winds blowing 50 meters above the surface of the earth.

V10M.name: Northward Wind at 10 Meters
V10M.definition: The estimate of the northward wind average speed for winds blowing 10 meters above the surface of the earth.

V2M.name: Northward Wind at 2 Meters
V2M.definition: The estimate of the northward wind average speed for winds blowing 2 meters above the surface of the earth.

V50M.name: Northward Wind at 50 Meters
V50M.definition: The estimate of the northward wind average speed for winds blowing 50 meters above the surface of the earth.

WD10M.name: Wind Direction at 10 Meters
WD10M.definition: The average of the wind direction at 10 meters above the surface of the earth.

WD2M.name: Wind Direction at 2 Meters
WD2M.definition: The average of the wind direction at 2 meters above the surface of the earth.

WD50M.name: Wind Direction at 50 Meters
WD50M.definition: The average of the wind direction at 50 meters above the surface of the earth.

WS10M.name: Wind Speed at 10 Meters
WS10M.definition: The average of wind speed at 10 meters above the surface of the earth.

WS10M_MAX.name: Wind Speed at 10 Meters Maximum
WS10M_MAX.definition: The maximum hourly wind speed at 10 meters above the surface of the earth.

WS10M_MAX_AVG.name: Wind Speed at 10 Meters Maximum Average
WS10M_MAX_AVG.definition: The average of the maximum daily wind speed at 10 meters above the surface of the earth.

WS10M_MIN.name: Wind Speed at 10 Meters Minimum
WS10M_MIN.definition: The minimum hourly wind speed at 10 meters above the surface of the earth.

WS10M_MIN_AVG.name: Wind Speed at 10 Meters Minimum Average
WS10M_MIN_AVG.definition: The average of the minimum daily wind speed at 10 meters above the surface of the earth.

WS10M_RANGE.name: Wind Speed at 10 Meters Range
WS10M_RANGE.definition: The minimum and maximum hourly wind speed range at 10 meters above the surface of the earth.

WS10M_RANGE_AVG.name: Wind Speed at 10 Meters Range Average
WS10M_RANGE_AVG.definition: The average minimum and maximum daily wind speed range at 10 meters above the surface of the earth.

WS2M.name: Wind Speed at 2 Meters
WS2M.definition: The average of wind speed at 2 meters above the surface of the earth.

WS2M_MAX.name: Wind Speed at 2 Meters Maximum
WS2M_MAX.definition: The maximum hourly wind speed at 2 meters above the surface of the earth.

WS2M_MAX_AVG.name: Wind Speed at 2 Meters Maximum Average
WS2M_MAX_AVG.definition: The average of the maximum daily wind speed at 2 meters above the surface of the earth.

WS2M_MIN.name: Wind Speed at 2 Meters Minimum
WS2M_MIN.definition: The minimum hourly wind speed at 2 meters above the surface of the earth.

WS2M_MIN_AVG.name: Wind Speed at 2 Meters Minimum Average
WS2M_MIN_AVG.definition: The average of the minimum daily wind speed at 2 meters above the surface of the earth.

WS2M_RANGE.name: Wind Speed at 2 Meters Range
WS2M_RANGE.definition: The minimum and maximum hourly wind speed range at 2 meters above the surface of the earth.

WS2M_RANGE_AVG.name: Wind Speed at 2 Meters Range Average
WS2M_RANGE_AVG.definition: The average minimum and maximum daily wind speed range at 2 meters above the surface of the earth.

WS50M.name: Wind Speed at 50 Meters
WS50M.definition: The average of wind speed at 50 meters above the surface of the earth.

WS50M_MAX.name: Wind Speed at 50 Meters Maximum
WS50M_MAX.definition: The maximum hourly wind speed at 50 meters above the surface of the earth.

WS50M_MAX_AVG.name: Wind Speed at 50 Meters Maximum Average
WS50M_MAX_AVG.definition: The average of the maximum daily wind speed at 50 meters above the surface of the earth.

WS50M_MIN.name: Wind Speed at 50 Meters Minimum
WS50M_MIN.definition: The minimum hourly wind speed at 50 meters above the surface of the earth.

WS50M_MIN_AVG.name: Wind Speed at 50 Meters Minimum Average
WS50M_MIN_AVG.definition: The average of the minimum daily wind speed at 50 meters above the surface of the earth.

WS50M_RANGE.name: Wind Speed at 50 Meters Range
WS50M_RANGE.definition: The minimum and maximum hourly wind speed range at 50 meters above the surface of the earth.

WS50M_RANGE_AVG.name: Wind Speed at 50 Meters Range Average
WS50M_RANGE_AVG.definition: The average minimum and maximum daily wind speed range at 50 meters above the surface of the earth.

Z0M.name: Surface Roughness
Z0M.definition: The height above the displacement plane at which the mean wind becomes zero when extrapolating the logarithmic wind speed profile downward through the surface layer.

ZENITH_LUMINANCE.name: Zenith luminance
ZENITH_LUMINANCE.definition: The average amount of luminance at the skys zenith.

ALLSKY_SFC_UV_INDEX_MAX.name: All Sky Surface UV Index Maximum
ALLSKY_SFC_UV_INDEX_MAX.definition: The maximum ultraviolet radiation exposure index.

ALLSKY_SFC_UV_INDEX_MIN.name: All Sky Surface UV Index Minimum
ALLSKY_SFC_UV_INDEX_MIN.definition: The minimum ultraviolet radiation exposure index.

ALLSKY_SFC_UV_INDEX_SD.name: All Sky Surface UV Index Standard Deviation
ALLSKY_SFC_UV_INDEX_SD.definition: The standard deviation of ultraviolet radiation exposure index.

ALLSKY_SFC_UVA.name: All Sky Surface UVA Irradiance
ALLSKY_SFC_UVA.definition: The ultraviolet A (UVA 315nm-400nm) irradiance under all sky conditions.

ALLSKY_SFC_UVA_MAX.name: All Sky Surface UVA Irradiance Maximum
ALLSKY_SFC_UVA_MAX.definition: The maximum ultraviolet A (UVA 315nm-400nm) irradiance under all sky conditions.

ALLSKY_SFC_UVA_MIN.name: All Sky Surface UVA Irradiance Minimum
ALLSKY_SFC_UVA_MIN.definition: The minimum ultraviolet A (UVA 315nm-400nm) irradiance under all sky conditions.

ALLSKY_SFC_UVA_SD.name: All Sky Surface UVA Irradiance Standard Deviation
ALLSKY_SFC_UVA_SD.definition: The standard deviation of ultraviolet A (UVA 315nm-400nm) irradiance under all sky conditions.

ALLSKY_SFC_UVB.name: All Sky Surface UVB Irradiance
ALLSKY_SFC_UVB.definition: The ultraviolet B (UVB 280nm-315nm) irradiance under all sky conditions.

ALLSKY_SFC_UVB_MAX.name: All Sky Surface UVB Irradiance Maximum
ALLSKY_SFC_UVB_MAX.definition: The maximum ultraviolet B (UVB 280nm-315nm) irradiance under all sky conditions.

ALLSKY_SFC_UVB_MIN.name: All Sky Surface UVB Irradiance Minimum
ALLSKY_SFC_UVB_MIN.definition: The minimum ultraviolet B (UVB 280nm-315nm) irradiance under all sky conditions.

ALLSKY_SFC_UVB_SD.name: All Sky Surface UVB Irradiance Standard Deviation
ALLSKY_SFC_UVB_SD.definition: The standard deviation of ultraviolet B (UVB 280nm-315nm) irradiance under all sky conditions.

AOD_55_ADJ.name: Adjusted Aerosol Optical Depth 55
AOD_55_ADJ.definition: The adjusted optical thickness at 0.55 um measured vertically; the component of the atmosphere to quantify the removal of radiant energy from an incident beam.

PRECSNO.name: Snow Precipitation
PRECSNO.definition: The snow precipitation at the surface of the earth.

SRF_ALB_ADJ.name: Surface Albedo Adjusted
SRF_ALB_ADJ.definition: The adjusted all sky rate of reflectivity of the earth's surface; the ratio of the solar energy reflected by the surface of the earth compared to the total solar energy incident reaching the surface of the earth.

TS_ADJ.name: Earth Skin Temperature Adjusted
TS_ADJ.definition: The adjusted average temperature at the earth's surface.

GWETTOP.name: Surface Soil Wetness
GWETTOP.definition: The percent of soil moisture a value of 0 indicates a completely water-free soil and a value of 1 indicates a completely saturated soil; where surface is the layer from the surfice 0 cm to 5 cm below grade.

ALLSKY_SFC_PAR_TOT.name: All Sky Surface PAR Total
ALLSKY_SFC_PAR_TOT.definition: The total Photosynthetically Active Radiation (PAR) incident on a horizontal plane at the surface of the earth under all sky conditions.

ALLSKY_SFC_PAR_TOT_MAX.name: All Sky Surface PAR Total Maximum
ALLSKY_SFC_PAR_TOT_MAX.definition: The maximum total Photosynthetically Active Radiation (PAR) incident on a horizontal plane at the surface of the earth under all sky conditions.

ALLSKY_SFC_PAR_TOT_MIN.name: All Sky Surface PAR Total Minimum
ALLSKY_SFC_PAR_TOT_MIN.definition: The minimum total Photosynthetically Active Radiation (PAR) incident on a horizontal plane at the surface of the earth under all sky conditions.

ALLSKY_SFC_PAR_TOT_SD.name: All Sky Surface PAR Total Standard Deviation
ALLSKY_SFC_PAR_TOT_SD.definition: The standard deviation of total Photosynthetically Active Radiation (PAR) incident on a horizontal plane at the surface of the earth under all sky conditions.

CLRSKY_SFC_PAR_TOT.name: Clear Sky Surface PAR Total
CLRSKY_SFC_PAR_TOT.definition: The total Photosynthetically Active Radiation (PAR) incident on a horizontal plane at the surface of the earth under clear sky conditions.

CLRSKY_SFC_PAR_TOT_MAX.name: Clear Sky Surface PAR Total Maximum
CLRSKY_SFC_PAR_TOT_MAX.definition: The maximum total Photosynthetically Active Radiation (PAR) incident on a horizontal plane at the surface of the earth under clear sky conditions.

CLRSKY_SFC_PAR_TOT_MIN.name: Clear Sky Surface PAR Total Minimum
CLRSKY_SFC_PAR_TOT_MIN.definition: The minimum total Photosynthetically Active Radiation (PAR) incident on a horizontal plane at the surface of the earth under clear sky conditions.

CLRSKY_SFC_PAR_TOT_SD.name: Clear Sky Surface PAR Total Standard Deviation
CLRSKY_SFC_PAR_TOT_SD.definition: The standard deviation of total Photosynthetically Active Radiation (PAR) incident on a horizontal plane at the surface of the earth under clear sky conditions.

GWETROOT.name: Root Zone Soil Wetness
GWETROOT.definition: The percent of root zone soil wetness a value of 0 indicates a completely water-free soil and a value of 1 indicates a completely saturated soil; where root zone is the layer from the surfice 0 cm to 100 cm below grade.

GWETPROF.name: Profile Soil Moisture
GWETPROF.definition: The percent of profile soil moisture a value of 0 indicates a completely water-free soil and a value of 1 indicates a completely saturated soil; where profile is the layer from the surface down to the bedrock.

AIRMASS.name: Air Mass
AIRMASS.definition: Air Mass according to Perez et al. 1990.

CLRSKY_SFC_SW_DIFF.name: Clear Sky Surface Shortwave Downward Diffuse Horizontal Irradiance
CLRSKY_SFC_SW_DIFF.definition: The diffuse (light energy scattered out of the direction of the sun) solar irradiance incident on a horizontal plane at the surface of the earth under clear sky conditions.

CLRSKY_SFC_SW_DIFF_MAX.name: Clear Sky Surface Shortwave Downward Diffuse Horizontal Irradiance Maximum
CLRSKY_SFC_SW_DIFF_MAX.definition: The maximum diffuse (light energy scattered out of the direction of the sun) solar irradiance incident on a horizontal plane at the surface of the earth under clear sky conditions.

CLRSKY_SFC_SW_DIFF_MIN.name: Clear Sky Surface Shortwave Downward Diffuse Horizontal Irradiance Minimum
CLRSKY_SFC_SW_DIFF_MIN.definition: The minimum diffuse (light energy scattered out of the direction of the sun) solar irradiance incident on a horizontal plane at the surface of the earth under clear sky conditions.

CLRSKY_SFC_SW_DIFF_SD.name: Clear Sky Surface Shortwave Downward Diffuse Horizontal Irradiance Standard Deviation
CLRSKY_SFC_SW_DIFF_SD.definition: The standard deviation of diffuse (light energy scattered out of the direction of the sun) solar irradiance incident on a horizontal plane at the surface of the earth under clear sky conditions.

CLRSKY_SFC_SW_DIRH.name: Clear Sky Surface Shortwave Direct Horizontal Irradiance
CLRSKY_SFC_SW_DIRH.definition: The direct solar irradiance incident on a horizontal plane at the surface of the earth under clear sky conditions.

CLRSKY_SFC_SW_DIRH_MAX.name: Clear Sky Surface Shortwave Direct Horizontal Irradiance Maximum
CLRSKY_SFC_SW_DIRH_MAX.definition: The maximum direct solar irradiance incident on a horizontal plane at the surface of the earth under clear sky conditions.

CLRSKY_SFC_SW_DIRH_MIN.name: Clear Sky Surface Shortwave Direct Horizontal Irradiance Minimum
CLRSKY_SFC_SW_DIRH_MIN.definition: The minimum direct solar irradiance incident on a horizontal plane at the surface of the earth under clear sky conditions.

CLRSKY_SFC_SW_DIRH_SD.name: Clear Sky Surface Shortwave Direct Horizontal Irradiance Standard Deviation
CLRSKY_SFC_SW_DIRH_SD.definition: The standard deviation of direct solar irradiance incident on a horizontal plane at the surface of the earth under clear sky conditions.

CLRSKY_SFC_SW_DNI.name: Clear Sky Surface Shortwave Downward Direct Normal Irradiance
CLRSKY_SFC_SW_DNI.definition: The direct solar irradiance incident to a horizontal plane normal (perpendicular) to the direction of the sun's position under clear sky conditions.

CLRSKY_SFC_SW_DNI_MAX.name: Clear Sky Surface Shortwave Downward Direct Normal Irradiance Maximum
CLRSKY_SFC_SW_DNI_MAX.definition: The maximum direct solar irradiance incident to a horizontal plane normal (perpendicular) to the direction of the sun's position under clear sky conditions.

CLRSKY_SFC_SW_DNI_MIN.name: Clear Sky Surface Shortwave Downward Direct Normal Irradiance Minimum
CLRSKY_SFC_SW_DNI_MIN.definition: The minimum direct solar irradiance incident to a horizontal plane normal (perpendicular) to the direction of the sun's position under clear sky conditions.

CLRSKY_SFC_SW_DNI_SD.name: Clear Sky Surface Shortwave Downward Direct Normal Irradiance
CLRSKY_SFC_SW_DNI_SD.definition: The standard deviation of direct solar irradiance incident to a horizontal plane normal (perpendicular) to the direction of the sun's position under clear sky conditions.
